meanings.definition: A collection of wild animals kept in captivity for exhibition.
meanings.sent1: The zoo had a menagerie of lions, tigers, and bears.
meanings.sent2: The circus featured a menagerie of exotic animals performing tricks.
meanings.sent3: The children were delighted by the menagerie of animals at the petting zoo.
meanings.sent4: Her room looked like a menagerie with all the stuffed animals scattered around.
meanings.sent5: The menagerie of colorful birds in the aviary was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: A diverse or varied group of people or things.
meanings.sent1: The party was a menagerie of different cultures, with music and food from around the world.
meanings.sent2: The classroom was a menagerie of students from various backgrounds.
meanings.sent3: The office felt like a menagerie of personalities, each unique in their own way.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were a menagerie of sounds, from honking cars to street performers.
meanings.sent5: The garden was a menagerie of flowers, each bloom more beautiful than the last.
